originalTitle: 'Affront to humanity': Sudan slams Uganda for hosting RSF paramilitary boss
title: 'Affront to humanity': Sudan slams Uganda for hosting RSF paramilitary boss
content: Sudan accuses Uganda of flouting international law by meeting Rapid Support Forces boss Mohamed Hamdan Dagalo.

originalTitle: Catch of the day: Pictures from spectacular Nigerian fishing festival
title: Catch of the day: Pictures from spectacular Nigerian fishing festival
content: Days of competition culminate in a fishing contest rooted in efforts to cement local peace.

originalTitle: Rare prison sentences handed to Cameroon soldiers after killing of 21 civilians
title: Rare prison sentences handed to Cameroon soldiers after killing of 21 civilians
content: In a rare occurence, three soldiers were handed jail terms for killings in the troubled Anglophone region.

originalTitle: Eze hurts Tottenham again to reignite Arsenal’s title hopes with 4-1 win
title: Arsenal's Big Win: Top of the Table!
content:
Hello, Football Fans!

Hello, my amazing friends! Guess what? We have some super exciting news from the world of football! Football is that fun game where players kick a ball with their feet. The goal is to get the ball into the other team's net. When the ball goes in, it's called a goal! Everyone loves a good goal, right? Today, we are talking about a very special game. It was a game full of energy, excitement, and lots of goals! So, let's dive into the fun news.

A Big Game in London

There are two very famous football teams in a big city called London. One team wears red and white. They are called Arsenal. The other team wears white and blue. They are called Tottenham. When these two teams play each other, it's a super big game! It's like when two friendly rivals from the same neighborhood play. We call this kind of game a "derby." It's extra special because both teams want to show who is the best in their city. Everyone gets very excited for these games! Did you know? London is a very big city in a country far away called England. Many football teams live there! This time, Arsenal played against Tottenham. It was a very important match for both teams. Fans were cheering very loudly. Everyone wanted their team to win. The players on the field ran very fast. They kicked the ball with all their might. They tried their best to get the ball into the net. It was a thrilling game to watch!

Who Scored the Goals?

In this big game, Arsenal scored many goals. They scored four goals! Wow, that's a lot! Tottenham scored one goal. So, Arsenal won with a score of 4 to 1. That's a super win for Arsenal! Two players from Arsenal were like superheroes. Their names are Gyokeres and Eze. These two players were amazing! Eze scored two goals. Imagine that! He kicked the ball into the net not once, but twice! That's called scoring a "brace" in football. It means two goals from one player in one game. Eze made the fans cheer very, very loudly! He was so happy when he scored. Did you know? When a player scores three goals in one game, it's called a "hat-trick"! That's even more amazing! Then, another fantastic player, Gyokeres, also scored two goals! He also got a "brace"! So, two players, Eze and Gyokeres, both scored two goals each. This helped Arsenal win the game by a lot. They were very strong and played together as a team. Every player on the field tried their best. They passed the ball to each other. They defended their goal very well. And most importantly, they scored!

Arsenal Wins Big!

So, the final score was Arsenal 4, Tottenham 1. This means Arsenal won the game! It was a big win, and it made all the Arsenal fans very, very happy. When a team wins by many goals, it shows they played really well. They worked together as a team. They had good plans to score goals. And their goalkeeper also worked hard to stop the other team from scoring. Winning this "derby" game against their city rivals, Tottenham, is extra special for Arsenal. It makes the fans feel proud. It also gives the players more confidence. They feel strong and ready for more games. This win was not just any win. It was a victory that made a big difference for Arsenal's journey in the football league. Every win helps a team get closer to being the best!

Top of the Table!

Now, let's talk about what this win means for Arsenal. Imagine a big list, like a scoreboard, where all the teams are lined up. This list shows which team has played best so far. We call this the "league table." Teams get "points" for winning games. If they win, they get three points. If they draw (play to a tie), they get one point. If they lose, they get zero points. Did you know? Sometimes, games can end in a draw, like 0-0 or 1-1. This means no team won, and they share the points! After winning this game, Arsenal moved to the "top of the table"! This means they are like the number one team right now in their league. They have more points than any other team. Not just that, they are now "five points clear" of the team in second place. This means they have five more points than the team below them. It's like being ahead in a race by a good distance! Being at the top is a very exciting place to be! It means they are doing a fantastic job this season. Everyone is watching to see if they can stay at the top.

Why This Win is Special

This big win for Arsenal means a lot for their "title hopes." What are "title hopes"? It means their hope to win the big shiny trophy at the end of the football season! Imagine a big cup or shield that the best team gets to lift. That's the "title"! Every team wants to win this title. By winning against Tottenham and going to the top of the table, Arsenal has a better chance to win that big trophy. It makes their dream of being champions come true. The fans are now dreaming even bigger! They think, "Yes! Our team can do it! They can win the league!" This win gives everyone more hope and excitement. It shows that Arsenal is a very strong team and they are trying their very best to be number one.

More Fun Football Facts!

Did you know? Football is the most popular sport in the world! Millions and millions of people play and watch football. It's played in almost every country! Did you know? A football match usually has two halves, and each half is 45 minutes long. So, the game lasts for 90 minutes in total, plus a little extra time! That's a lot of running! Did you know? The person in the special jersey who tries to stop the ball from going into the net is called the goalkeeper. They can use their hands! All other players mostly use their feet. Did you know? The referee is the person who makes sure all the players follow the rules of the game. They wear a different coloured uniform and blow a whistle! Did you know? Football is sometimes called "soccer" in countries like America and Canada. But most places in the world call it "football"! It's all the same fun game.

Keep Cheering!

So, there you have it, little champions! Arsenal won a big game against Tottenham, 4-1! Eze and Gyokeres scored amazing goals. And now, Arsenal is at the top of the league table, hoping to win the big trophy! It's a very exciting time for football fans. Keep watching, keep cheering for your favorite teams, and remember that playing sports is always a lot of fun! See you next time for more exciting news!
summary: Arsenal won a big football game against Tottenham by scoring 4 goals to 1, and two players, Eze and Gyokeres, scored two goals each, which put Arsenal at the very top of the league table.
whyMatters: This win is very important for Arsenal because it means they are now in the best spot to try and win the big shiny trophy at the end of the season, making all their fans super happy and hopeful!

originalTitle: Burnt vehicles line highway near Mexican World Cup stadium
title: Burnt vehicles line highway near Mexican World Cup stadium
content: Burnt out buses and trucks lined the highway to Guadalajara, Mexico’s Estadio Akron.

originalTitle: Netanyahu says Israel will forge regional alliance to rival ‘radical axes’
title: Netanyahu says Israel will forge regional alliance to rival ‘radical axes’
content: Israeli PM says his country is working to counter what he called 'radical Shia axis' and 'emerging radical Sunni axis'.

originalTitle: Armed man killed after entering secure perimeter of Trump's residence, Secret Service says
title: Armed man killed after entering secure perimeter of Trump's residence, Secret Service says
content: The suspect was carrying a shotgun and fuel can when he was killed, officers said. Trump was in Washington DC at the time.

originalTitle: Pakistan launches deadly strikes on Afghanistan
title: Pakistan launches deadly strikes on Afghanistan
content: Pakistan says the strikes were retaliation for recent suicide bombings in the country.

originalTitle: Bones of St Francis of Assisi go on public display in Italy
title: Bones of St Francis of Assisi go on public display in Italy
content: The remains of Italy's patron saint have only been seen in public once before - for one day in 1978.

originalTitle: How Sheff Wed's earliest-ever relegation unfolded
title: How Sheff Wed's earliest-ever relegation unfolded
content: Sheffield Wednesday are the first EFL club to go down in February - here is how a season to forget unfolded.

originalTitle: Phillips will 'suffer' after latest red card setback
title: Phillips will 'suffer' after latest red card setback
content: Sheffield United boss Chris Wilder does not believe his side are "reckless" despite Kalvin Phillips being the latest player to be sent off.

originalTitle: Chelsea, Arsenal and Man City into Women's FA Cup quarters
title: Chelsea, Arsenal and Man City into Women's FA Cup quarters
content: Holders Chelsea edged out Manchester United to reach the quarter-finals of the Women's FA Cup, while Arsenal and Man City cruise through with comfortable wins.
